page.title: 04THE CHURCHES IN PROBUS
page.content: {The Churches in Probus} The medieval church of Probus,with the tallest tower in Cornwall,is in the centre of the village.In a nearby street is the small Methodist chapel,methodism arriving here about 1781.The churches have some joint services annually & produce a joint monthly magazine.On Sundays the average Methodist congregation is about 20.With declining numbers their previous large chapel was sold to a firm of antique dealers.In the Anglican church an average congregation is about 60,over double ten years ago.The vicar is one of two in a team ministry for 6 churches.This new team organisation is not liked by older people as there is less time for individuals,but it saves money on salaries,heating & other resourses.
